I'm going to be taking on the Everesting challenge on Zwift. It's simple - climb 8,848m or the equivalent of Everest in one ride. You are only allowed to use one climb, which you have to ride up and down repeatedly to make the height gain.

 Alpe du Zwift is 516m at its peak. I'm expecting to have to ride the segment 16 or 17 times, equating to about 200km in the saddle. Zwift allows you to freewheel downhill, so loo breaks can be taken while "descending". Other than that, it's going to be hard work and the threat of a pretty numb bum.
Title: Dan is Everesting Alpe Du Zwift!

Description:
During the coronavirus pandemic, our team at AquaQ Analytics wanted to do something a bit mad to raise money for local food banks.

Our staff have been doing stair shuffles to keep active and get donations in, with the company donating £100 for each video received.

Check out our website to see a compilation of all our stair shuffle efforts!
Title: Donate to South-West Belfast Foodbank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Everyone hates burpees. Fact. What began as a challenge between friends we hope can turn into something good that can raise funds for the Lewisham food bank who are doing amazing things to look after the most vulnerable in our local community.

So, we have set ourselves the challenge of doing 1,000 burpees (each) in a day. It won’t be easy but hopefully knowing we are making a difference to those who need it most during these tough times will get us through!

The Lewisham food bank is part of a network of over 400 food banks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in our local community, as well as across the UK. They provide food to those in need - something of particular importance as we fight the current Coronavirus. 

We hope our efforts will help raise funds for the food bank and awareness of all the good they are doing within our local community. Any donations would be very much appreciated!
Title: Steve and James do the 1,000 burpee challenge!

Description:
Feeding Families: Covid-19 Emergency Appeal

The ongoing lockdown is affecting us all, but for many families living in the slums of Kampala it has been devastating.

To meet this crisis, Kids Club Kampala - a small but ambitious and impactful charity, with a small team in the UK, and a team in Kampala employing local Ugandans - are running emergency food banks for vulnerable families to get them through this time.

They have already provided 982,107 emergency food packages, but need further help.

I have joined a collective challenge to run, skip and cycle the distance from here to Uganda along with a bigger team of about a dozen of us. We will be completing 1600 miles in total over a 10 week period. I have pledged to cover 200 miles by the end of August.

Each of us is aiming to raise £300 from our own networks and friends. We really appreciate any of your support especially during this uncertain time for everyone.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Ruthie's page

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Elizabeth's Keep on playing

Description:
While we're all stuck at home, I wanted to do something to put a smile on your face, and raise some money for the Trussell Trust. The national charity's network of food banks are expecting to see an increase in need over the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds.

To help, and hopefully(!) brighten up your day, I am dedicating my mornings to video call as many of you who donate as possible. All you need to do is donate to the Trussell Trust on this page, ensure your phone number is included in your donation, and tick that you are happy to receive further communications so that I am allowed to call you!

By donating, not only will you be in for the chance of a receiving a video call from me, but you will also help people struggling as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. 

Food banks were already seeing an increased need before this outbreak but it's likely that more people than ever will be unable to afford their own food over the coming weeks, especially people who have unstable jobs or who aren't eligible for sick pay, and will need to turn to a food bank for support. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over half a million of these of these going to children. 

Your donations will help the Trussell Trust support food banks in their network and ensure people in crisis can access emergency food during this challenging time. This money could help fund vans to help food banks deliver food to people's homes, buy food (if necessary and available!), recruit additional staff to meet the demand, but also, vitally, campaign for change so that everyone can afford their own food. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I look forward to chatting to a few of you over the coming days.

NOW FOR THE LEGAL PART: 

All funds raised will go directly to the Trussell Trust. You can find out more about the organisation on their website www.trusselltrust.org. 

I will try to call as many of you as possible but it might not be possible to speak to everyone who donates. 

Please note that I can only contact you if you provide a phone number and ‘opt in’ to share their details with the Trussell Trust. 

The Trussell Trust is committed to protecting your privacy and will process any personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Act 2018. Your details will be kept safe and secure, only used by the Trussell Trust or those who work for us and will not be shared, sold or rented to third parties for marketing purposes. In this instance, your details (first name, phone number and amount donated), will be shared with Michael McIntyre for the purposes of this fundraising event only.

We may use information you provide for analysis, research or screening purposes in order to help us understand our supporters so that we can save resources and deliver the best possible service.
Title: Michael McIntyre is supporting the Trussell Trust

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks
Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 
At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.

We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!

It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.

Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.


Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.

Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.

However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!

Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.
#GreatBritishFast
#fast4foodbanks 

If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.

The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.
.......
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description:
Please join me on the Boxing Day 2019 from Midday for my charity stream to help raise as much money as we can for such an amazing cause.

You can find me at www.twitch.tv/nelinde

If you can't make a donation fear not! You can help by spreading the word and sharing this JustGiving page on social media and with friends and family.


No one should go hungry, especially at Xmas! 

Yet thousands of families are going without food due to poverty, parents going without so their children don't have empty bellies.

This is 2019! This shouldn't even be a thing... Sadly so many people in the UK are in this dire situation. It could be a neighbour or even a family member!

UK Food Banks are vastly overstretched and are in need of food donations more than ever before to meet the highest demands ever to be recorded since the Trussell Trust started in 1999!


But you can help spread a little Xmas cheer <3 


Please spare what you can afford, as little as £2 can afford a single meal!

You can also help by donating any spare "long shelf life" foods such as tinned vegetables etc to your local Food Bank or supermarket Food Bank collection box <3

Having personally relied on my local Food Bank in previous times of hardship I have first hand experience of the effect and contribution Food Banks have on so many people facing financial hardship and not being able to afford food for their families or themselves. They provide a light in times of darkness, often providing much more than just food. 

They offer an ear to listen, a personal connection where there is nothing but loneliness. Many Food Banks even provide clothing that they've had donated. My local Food Bank even run a free playgroup where parents can go to meet other parents and make friendships.

I can't stress how much a small donation can help <3






Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description:
On the 25th April this year I was supposed to travel over to the Highlands and run the Highland fling 54mile ultra marathon with a few mates.  Covid-19 has put a stop to that and confined us all to our homes.  I’ve found that hard but it strikes me that many people have it far worse!  Food banks are sadly going to be vital for many in the coming weeks and months so I have decided to still do the 54 miles, in my garden (1080 laps) to raise money for my local food bank charity.  If you are able to donate, I’d be really grateful.  Below you’ll find some info about my chosen charity.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description:
I set this page up for last year's marathon but it was then cancelled and this year's one moved to October. 

Before Christmas 2020 I read a lot about food banks in the UK and found it quite shocking. Not a lot has changed now and so I want to try to raise some more money. There are more people using them than ever in many parts of the country, and the Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of over 1200 food banks. They provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year and during the coronavirus pandemic food banks have seen need rise even further.

I know I have run the marathon before, and I know I have asked for donations before. But this seems like a really worthy cause and an issue that worries me a lot so I hope people will find a few spare quid to donate. I will definitely top up the final total myself too as I feel in a very fortunate to be running the London Marathon and want to complete the race knowing it has also done some good. 

If you are a UK taxpayers and want to sponsor me please tick the Gift Aid box. This enables them to claim an extra 25p per £1 you donate at no extra cost to you. A £10 donation will be transformed into £12.50 and makes a huge difference so please do so. 

Many thanks 

Jeffers

Description:
The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.

The Salvation Army each Christmas works hard to ensure that no child goes without a present. 2020 has been a difficult year for lots of people and more and more people are finding themselves out of work, or with less income than normal. This will have an affect on what they can afford this Christmas. 

We have already started to receive referrals of families who are in need of the support of a Christmas Hamper containing food and gifts and we know that there are more referrals to come as we get closer to the Christmas period. Help us to ensure that no families or individuals go without this Christmas. 

The restrictions of the current pandemic means that we cannot as a charity collect in are normal ways so we need your help now to ensure that we can support as many people as possible over the festive period.

That’s why we provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. Description:
iQra FC have accepted to play against SOS FC (Shoot on sight) in a friendly charity match to raise funds in order to send food packs to Bangladesh.

iQra FC vs SOS FC

DETAILS

  • Location: Beckton Power League
  • Date: Sunday 26th October 2020
  • Time: 2PM Kick off
  • 7 a side and 2 subs allowed

Since early June, monsoon related floods have affected millions of people in south and east Asia and the worst afflicted being Bangladesh, where more than a quarter of the country has been inundated. Please help us to create awareness and funds.

Emergency Flood Appeal in Bangladesh -  A THIRD OF BANGLADESH IS FLOODED!

Since early June, monsoon-related floods have affected millions of people in the south and east Asia and the worst afflicted being Bangladesh where more than a quarter of the country has been flooded. Officials have reported that 4 million people have been affected and near a hundred people have died from this disaster.

Every year there is flooding during the monsoon season in Bangladesh but this is the worst in decades. The situation has made life very hard for many, especially farmers who depend on their livestock.

One farmer mentioned how 'the water kept on rising'. He, his family nor his cattle could go out. They needed a small boat to get about. They could not cook on their cooker or sleep on their own beds as it has gone underwater. This is just a story of one farmer. Can you imagine how many stories you will hear when talking to the 1 million people who have had to move away from their homes as there's nothing left.

The flooding has ruined crops and people's livelihoods even for what little they had. Now more than a million are on the move.

Bangladesh's Flood Forecast Centre has warned the situation could get worse with major rivers expecting to rise in the coming days.

This is why iQra International Bangladesh team have been on the ground assisting and helping as many people as they possibly can with medical kits, food, household supplies and more. Please help iQra International with your continuous support.

iQra International useful packages:

Food Pack (month) - £50

Emergency Medical Aid - £75

Household Goods (pots and pans) - £100

House Repair - £175

Wheelchair - £100

10 Water Filter - £100

Tube well - £250

Sponsor a Child (year) - £300

Please donate as generously as you can, please share this and finally make prayer that iQra International can help and overcome this hardship for millions of people.

It is super easy to get involved and help, you can pay using these mentioned below just follow the simple steps:

  • -Apple Pay
  • -Google Pay
  • -Debit Card Payment

Or you can Bank Transfer to the details below:

  • iQra International
  • Sort Code: 20-57-06
  • Account no: 90400203
  • Barclays Bank

*Please use the package as a reference.

If you made it here, Thank you so much! It means a lot to us that you are engaged and have the intention to help. Remember if you cant help by donating you can still help with the following tips below:

1. Share this on your social media stories every day!

2. Try to raise a small amount between family and friends together.

Thank you!
Title: Charity Football Match iQra FC vs SOS FC

Description:
Hi, I'm Dan and I've decided to cycle from Clitheroe to Bicester to Redhill (260+miles) to raise money for Action Against Hunger. I'll be setting off on October 24th and hope to reach Redhill at some point the following day. It is a cycling tour in honour of Britain's greatest Olive/Plant-based manufacturing sites! I'll be doing this on my own, unsupported, in what is likely to be testing weather conditions. I can't say I'm looking forward to it to be honest...but it is for a fantastic cause!

Action Against Hunger is a global humanitarian organisation whose mission is to create a world free from hunger. Right now, that mission is more difficult than ever, due to the dramatic impact of Covid-19 on charities’ fundraising. But this mission is also more important than ever, as the threat of coronavirus hits the world’s most vulnerable communities, like those living in refugee camps where social distancing is simply not possible.

Some examples of how your donations could help:

  • £25 could fund an emergency kitchen kit for a family of 5 people
  • £42 could save the life of a severely malnourished child through a course of ready-to-use therapeutic foods
  • £110 could provide chlorine tablets to ensure safe drinking water for 833 peoples for 20 days during an epidemic

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Title: The Compleat Food Cycle 2020

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Wellingborough Salvation Army Christmas Appeal

Description:
Together, The Co-operative Bank and Capita we will not rest until we end youth homelessness. Will you join us and donate today?

110,000 young people in the UK are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Some are facing serious danger on the streets. Many are too scared to sleep. In partnership with The Co-operative Bank, Capita colleagues will not rest until we change that and we want you to join us. For the first time ever, we are staying up all night to help end youth homelessness.

Your donations will make a huge difference to the lives of vulnerable young people across the UK.

Thank you for your support from all of us at Capita, The Co-operative Bank and Centrepoint.

Find out more by heading to https://stayup.centrepoint.org.uk
Title: Capita and The Co-operative Bank are staying up for homeless young people

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As a 9 year old child at school, I've been given a task of coming up with a challenge to achieve before the end of year 5. I decided to help raise money for save the children.

I'm doing this because it will help children have a better future. I'm very lucky to have food, water, clothes, good health and an education however many children across the world don't. So that's why we're asking you to donate to save the children.

Many thanks for your support.

Zoe.
Title: Zoe's year 5 fundraising challenge

Description:
MDS UK is the only charity in the UK providing vital support, information, advice and conducting research solely into Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS)- a rare blood cancer where the bone marrow fails to produce healthy blood cells. We are a small charity that needs YOUR support!

The 20for20 challenge means doing a set challenge or multiple challenges for 20 days to raise support and awareness for MDS. I've chosen to do various sport activities for 20 days involving the number 20. I've been alternating between throwing the frisbee at least 20 times a day, 20 mins of HIIT, 20km cycle, 20min run, etc.. I will be starting on the 20th November until 10th December 2020. Please donate as much as you can, even if it's 50p per daily activity. Thank you!
Title: Brechje's 20for20 sports and food extravaganza for MDS UK

Description:
Welcome to our fundraising page for The Hygiene Bank Dungannon.

Galvanised by the belief that being clean is not a luxury or a privilege, The Hygiene Bank is a registered, people powered, grassroots charity grounded in community. We collect and re-distribute donated toiletries, hygiene, beauty and personal care items to local charities, voluntary organisations and schools. These in turn are then given for free to their beneficiaries. Our passion stems from a sense of injustice: it's not right that anyone should face hygiene poverty!
Title: THE HYGIENE BANK DUNGANNON

Description:
Over the last two years and especially in 2020 (espcially with COVID-19) I have lost some family and dear friends to different terminal or life shortning illnesses.

I wanted to do something significant to raise funds to for a charity (Hospice UK) that support their care. 

I will be cycling 450km over 3 days with the Deutsche
Bank’s Scottish Challenge Cycle team in Inverness, Scotland to raise funds the Hospice UK charity.

Cycling up to 450km in the cold, wet hills of Inverness Scotland is probably the biggest physical endurance challenge of my life and the first time I will actively raise funds for any charity.  

Hospice UK is the national charity for hospice and palliative care. It works to ensure all adults and children living with a terminal or life-shortening illness receive the care and support they need, when they need it.

For the next two years Deutsche Bank employees will be running, cycling, volunteering and unlocking long-term value for Hospice UK. We will be working together to transform hospice care and encourage more open conversations about death, dying and grief. 

Thank you so much for supporting me and Hospice UK. You are helping to ensure that hospices can continue to give vital time and care to around 200,000 adults and children with a terminal illness every year, alongside their loved ones.

Title: #HelloYellow @ Holbeach Bank Academy

Description:
Hundreds of
thousands of tonnes of good food is wasted by the UK food industry every year.
At the same time, millions of people are struggling to afford to eat. Children
in education have no food waiting at home; school dinners are the only meal in
their day. When schools were shut due to coronavirus, some students had
struggled to have nutritious meals. I am fortunate to have food on the table
when I get home from a day of school. Unfortunately, not everyone is as lucky.

FareShare is
an organisation that redistributes surplus food to charities that turn it into
meals. 250,000 tonnes of edible food goes to waste each year, but the charity
uses the waste hierarchy. The waste hierarchy sets out five steps for dealing
with waste, ranked according to their environmental impact. It states that excess
food should be used to feed people first before it is sent to animal feed or
energy.

8.4 million
people in the UK are struggling to afford to eat. This is equivalent to the
entire population of London. Their research shows that 46% of people accessing
the services of our charity partners have gone a whole day without a proper
meal in the last month. They need help.

I have
always cared about the food on my plate, and the change of atmosphere has made
me realise how privileged I am compared to others. I sympathise with them, as
they are living days with one substantial meal a day, which is when I realised
that we all take our food for granted. Therefore, I will fast for a day. I have
always had a large appetite, and missing food for a day will be a challenge.
This makes my fundraising more purposeful, as I can empathise with those less
lucky.

I was
inspired when my mum went to work for a school which distributes for the
FareShare charity. Half of each year group on average are provided with free
school meals. It makes me realise how much I take for granted.

CharityName: University College London Hospitals Charity UK
Description:
CJD is a horrid disease. It doesn’t only affect the person suffering from this horrid disease but it leaves families devastated in the wake. 

CJD takes important people - We need a cure. As soon as possible. 

One month being vegan.

Support us to find a cure for Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD). There is currently no cure but every day scientists and doctors are getting closer to finding a treatment. We aim to raise funds to support the use of an antibody drug developed for the treatment of patients with CJD. The first patient was treated at UCLH in October 2018.
Title: Melissa's Vegan Challenge page

Description:
This October, the Co-operative Bank Finance team will be Staying Active by undertaking a challenge to circumnavigate our home - Manchester - as many times as we can, on foot or by bike to raise money for a fantastic cause.

Last year we took part in the Sleep Out to raise awareness of homelessness, however due to the ongoing world pandemic we have had to do things a little different this year.

The Stay Up : Stay Active initiative raises money to help challenge the story for thousands of homeless 16-25 year loads in the UK.  110,000 young people experience homelessness every year and the effects can be devastating.

 The Co-operative Bank's main charity partner, Centrepoint, supports young people to recover their health and find a job and home of their own.  Their approach works and 88% of those they work with leave Centrepoint positively. 

If you feel able to support we'd be grateful for a donation, no matter how small.
Title: The Co-operative Bank Stay Active Challenge

Description:
UPDATE (2/12/20)

The competition has closed, thanks to all those who supported us!

We haven't collected enough recipes to make a book yet but we will continue to collect any recipes that are sent in. The recipes we have been sent all look wonderful and prize-winners have been notified.

To submit your recipe simply send it, with a picture, to fundraising@obanlifeboat.co.uk and it will, if you pardon the pun, go into the mix!

Thanks for helping us to Save Lives at Sea!

UPDATE: The competition is extended to the end of November, so you have more time to practise your favourite dishes!

Fishing and seafood are at the heart of Oban, so is our Lifeboat which is one of the busiest in Scotland! All of this combined makes us excited about this year’s Fish Supper campaign!

On this page, you can donate to support lifeboats in Scotland (thank you!), and you can enter our seafood recipes competition – more details on that below.

Oban Lifeboat Seafood Recipes

We want to find the best seafood recipes that RNLI supporters serve and collect the best of them into a recipe book: Oban Lifeboat Seafood Recipes. To enter, make a donation here on this JustGiving page and email your recipe to the address in the thank you message, along with

a picture of the complete dish and stating whether you want to enter
the under 18 or over 18 category.

By entering the competition you, or your legal guardian if under 18, are consenting to us reproducing your recipe for publicity purposes and within the Oban Lifeboat Seafood Recipe Book if chosen as one of the best 30.

This activity is open to entries from October 9th 2020 to November 9th 2020. Winners will be notified in the week ending November 20th 2020 and the book will be published, initially in digital form, as soon as possible thereafter and will be publicly available for download in return for a donation to the RNLI.

The entrants of the 3 best recipes, in each class, under-18 and over-18, will win prizes of RNLI merchandise, including aprons, tea-towels and Oban Lifeboat mugs as well as a digital copy of Oban Lifeboat Seafood Recipes!

Recipes will be judged by a panel in terms of:

  • simplicity - can the dish be made in an 'ordinary' kitchen by an 'ordinary' cook;
  • availability - using generally available ingredients with an emphasis on local, sustainable supplies; and
  • creativity - your individual approach or twist, for example an unusual combination; and
  • appearance - does the dish make the judges want to taste it?

Across Scotland lifeboats protect hundreds of communities with a 24-hour search and rescue service. Their volunteer crews rely on the safest, most reliable lifeboats and modern stations to launch from. They rely on donations from the public to continue saving lives at sea and on inland waters - your donation to this page will help support the running of the lifeboat stations in Scotland.

In the event of difficulty with this please e-mail us at fundraising@obanlifeboat.co.uk

Photos courtesy of Stephen Lawson - thanks Stephen!
Title: Oban Lifeboat "Fish Supper" Fundraiser

for the next two years Deutsche Bank employees will be running, cycling, volunteering and unlocking long-term value for Hospice UK. Title: Co-op charity partnership

Description:
Hi all! 

Over the next 2 years Deutsche Bank will be supporting Hospice UK, a charity which provides care to over 200 thousand people with terminal or life-limiting illnesses, as well as support for their loved ones in very difficult times. 

I've recently learned a lot about the care the hospice provide when my mum trained as bereavement support at Katherine House Hospice in Banbury. Her and other volunteers provide support to those who have lost their loved ones to help them through the most difficult of times. 

It would be really amazing if you could help me raise money to enable them to keep doing the incredible work they do!

Thank you, 

Charlotte

PS. I know what you're thinking - i love cycling! I have paid for the trip part of the trip in full - your donations will go to Hospice UK :)
Title: Charlotte's page

Description:
Update...We're still trying to beat last years total of £5,500!

On Saturday 24th October we are embarking on a challenge to walk 50 miles from Chesterfield to the Bet 365 stadium Stoke - in one go!

Myself, my dad and the team will be doing this in honour of my late Grandad Gordon Banks, and to raise money and awareness of the great work the Douglas Macmillan hospice does in our community.

Starting at Chesterfield on Saturday at 2pm, walking through the night (NO SLEEP) and finishing back at Stoke City - Bet365 Stadium on Sunday around 2pm. My Grandads first and final clubs.

We will be walking through the evening, night and day with the support of some local companies including Wrights Pies, Ken Jervis Kia and Stanton's to ensure we are fuelled up on both food and support vehicles.

I'd like to thanks Duncan Cowan's on behalf of the Banks family and the rest of the team who's made this walk possible, planning everything to military precision. Without your hard work none of this would be possible. Thank you.

Check out the gallery at the top of the page to see the route we're walking (VERY HILLY), and please please donate to a great cause! We're really trying to beat last year's target of £5,500 so please help us reach that every little helps ❤️🤍

Thanks

Matt Banks
Title: Gordon Banks Legend Walk page

Description: Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the landscape of dementia forever. Until the day we find a cure, we will create a society where those affected by dementia are supported and accepted, able to live in their community without fear or prejudice.

Description:

As well as the on-line harvest supper, we are holding harvest services at St Francis' and St Mary's West Wickham where we will gather donations for the Foodbank.

Description:
For the next two years Deutsche Bank employees will be running, cycling, volunteering and unlocking long-term value for Hospice UK. We will be working together to transform hospice care and encourage more open conversations about death, dying and grief. Thank you very much for supporting Hospice UK. You are helping to ensure that hospices can continue to give vital time and care to around 200,000 adults and children with a terminal illness every year, alongside their loved ones.

Hospice care is such a vital service, making such a huge difference for people with terminal illnesses and their families. My mother was briefly in hospice care before she passed away last year. I would like to dedicate the ride I will try to undertake this year to her memory.

The ride covers a good distance, and includes the longest continuous ascent in the UK (in terms of height) - Bealach-Na-Ba, climbing 626m in about 6 miles, reaching a 20% incline in parts. My local training climb - the highest in Essex, climbs about 100m, in a couple of miles, and leaves me gasping for breath at the top... so this should be interesting!

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. 

With many months into a pandemic, the situation is even more urgent.

More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us.  

With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Harish's Wheels for Change 2020

Description:
This October The Co-operative Bank is taking on the challenge of a night-time, colleagues will be staying up from 8pm to 8am, joining thousands of others across the country and going one night without sleep for homeless young people.

STAY:UP raises money to help change the story for thousands of homeless 16-25 year olds in the UK. 110,000 young people experience homelessness every year and the effects can be devastating.

Centrepoint supports young people to recover their health and find a job and home of their own. Their approach works and 88% of those they work with leave Centrepoint positively.

Please sponsor as much as you can because although we will be spending just one night outside of our comfort zones, homeless young people will have faced much worse.

Description:
In November and December of 2020 we , as a regional team, will commit to and travel 2673 miles under our own steam. This will be GPS tracked on Strava so you can follow our pain and celebrate our achievements (maybe) all safe in the knowledge that we aren't cheating by shaking our Fitbits ....as if we would eh?!

2673 miles will get us to Bethlehem before Christmas Day, not exactly the three wise men I grant you but that’s the kind of distance that we will collectively travel by adding our activities together. That’s also over 5.5 million steps or 4447 km for the metric lovers 

We need to remind Covid 19 that it can't stop us supporting others and this is how we will do so with your generous help.

All you need to do is donate to our JustGiving page remembering to leave your store name or your name and a message so we can stop hassling you for support (money) 😉
Title: Region 2's Money for Miles page

Description:
I will be taking part in a sponsored walk across the most iconic bridges in London to help raise vital funds for pregnant Syrian refugee women and their new-born babies.

My target is to try and raise a minimum of £200 but if we can go above this then all the better. The money raised will go towards providing free medical care to our pregnant Syrian refugee sisters and their new-born babies. We all know how important this is, our sisters need the support and our babies deserve a chance that so many of us take for granted.

By donating to my page will go towards Islamic help project in Jordan. They have a birth clinic there that helps:

£20 – This donation provides a baby with new clothes and essentials.
£30 – This donation provides routine health checks for a pregnant woman.
£300 – Covers Cost of Birth (baby delivery) And Family
Aftercare 
£600 – Covers Cost of a C Section birth (baby delivery) and family aftercare

For more information please check out Islamic Help website:  

https://www.islamichelp.org.uk/birth-clinic/


Click the link to see Islamic Helps Birth Campaign video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ARdWBUGBqZs


Thank You.



Islamic Help is a UK-registered charity delivering sustainable solutions that empower people in need. Our work is underpinned by our core values – honesty, transparency, integrity and accountability.Since launch, we've empowered over 10 million people worldwide.Over the past 17 years, we have provided urgent aid and sustainable relief to thousands of disadvantaged people across the globe, including right here in the UK.
Title: 10 Bridge Trek

Description:
I'm cycling >400km in October to support DB's charity of the year, Hospice UK, the national charity for hospice & palliative care.  Hospice UK care for vulnerable people, & need help supporting the nurses & clinical staff putting their lives at risk during the COVID-19 crisis.

A donation here won't send me on a jolly. I'm paying my own way & will make my own donation. The money you give will help the charity, & their work.

I've connected my Strava, so training rides, & the DB cycle itself (14-18 October), should show here.

I don't like asking for help, but this isn't for me, it's for those in genuine need.

I really appreciate, and am grateful for your support.

Andrew.
Title: Andrew's page
